intro: Cremanthodium reniforme, commonly known as the kidneyleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are often kidney-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
